item.title: 气候变化暴露了家庭保险的重大缺口
item.description: 房屋保险对于灾后重建至关重要。然而，越来越多的房主发现，保险赔付金额可能不足以重建家园。【原文：Home insurance is essential for recovering after disaster hits. But, as an increasing number of homeowners are finding out, payouts may not be enough to rebuild.】

item.title: 洛杉矶火灾幸存者遭遇粗暴对待，更多美国人可能面临同样遭遇
item.description:
许多家庭保险政策无法覆盖灾后重建的全部费用，随着气候变化影响的加剧，这一问题预计将日益严重。 

【原文：

Many home insurance policies don’t cover the full cost of rebuilding after a disaster, a problem that’s set to grow along with the impacts of climate change. 

】

item.title: 尽管美国补贴政策终止，廉价电动SUV仍可能影响消费者购买决策
item.description:
日产、通用等车企正推出定价策略旨在抵消美国绿色激励政策终止影响的新车型。【原文：

Nissan, GM and others are launching new models with a price tag designed to offset the end of green incentives in the US.

】

item.title: 至少26年来最严重洪水导致克鲁格国家公园关闭，数十人死亡
item.description: 南非关闭了其旗舰克鲁格国家公园，此前该保护区大片区域遭遇了至少2000年以来最严重的洪水侵袭。这场区域性灾难已造成该国东北部及邻国莫桑比克数十人死亡，凸显了灾情的严重性。【原文：South Africa shut its flagship Kruger National Park after the worst flooding since at least 2000 inundated large areas of the reserve, underscoring the severity of a regional disaster that has killed dozens in the northeast of the nation and neighboring Mozambique.】

item.title: 华尔街对股市表现最佳板块意见分歧
item.description: 在地区地缘政治紧张局势加剧的背景下，能源股的强劲涨势持续跑赢大盘，引发了关于这波涨势能持续多久的讨论。【原文：A market-beating rally in energy stocks amid flaring geopolitical tensions has sparked a debate about how long the momentum will last.】

item.title: 中国修订电池法规，电动报废车浪潮迫在眉睫
item.description: 中国宣布出台新规追踪旧车电池，以防止其被非法回收，因为该国正面临日益增多的电动报废车问题。【原文：China announced new rules to track old car batteries to prevent them from being recycled illegally as the country faces a growing number of electric clunkers.】

item.title: 研究发现贸易冲击可能导致英国9万个绿色就业岗位消失
item.description: 一份新报告警告称，英国在实现气候目标方面过度依赖中国，若全球供应链遭受冲击，该国清洁能源行业恐将面临大规模失业风险。【原文：Britain risks widespread job losses across the clean-energy sector if global supply chains are hit by shocks, according to a new report that warns the country is too reliant on China for its climate ambitions.】

item.title: 私募股权公司NGP斥资2亿美元押注美国电池产业，人工智能推动电力需求激增
item.description: 私募股权公司NGP能源资本管理公司正向一家美国新兴储能开发商注资2亿美元，因数据中心推动电力需求创纪录增长。【原文：Private equity firm NGP Energy Capital Management is backing a new US energy-storage developer with $200 million as data centers spur record power demand growth.】

item.title: 格蕾塔的祖国瑞典在气候问题上临阵退缩
item.description: 环保活动家格蕾塔·通贝里（Greta Thunberg）的祖国瑞典，曾是绿色政策和清洁能源转型的坚定支持者。如今已非如此。【原文：Activist Greta Thunberg’s home country Sweden was once a stalwart for green policies and the clean energy transition. Not anymore.】

item.title: 为何气候友好型牛肉标签未能达标
item.description:
一项由环保非营利组织进行的研究发现，牛肉生产商未能为其环保主张提供充分证据。【原文：

A study by an environmental nonprofit found beef producers aren’t providing enough evidence for their green assertions.

】

item.title: 特朗普的稀土政策为绿色科技行业提供救命稻草
item.description:
2025年，随着美国着手构建对国防和能源领域至关重要的元素供应链，该行业获得了创纪录的资金投入。【原文：

The industry saw record funding in 2025 as the US looks to build out a supply chain of elements crucial to the defense and energy sectors.

】

item.title: 嘉吉航运负责人称油价低迷使减排更难实现
item.description: 商品巨头嘉吉公司货运贸易业务总裁表示，疲软的油价正使航运业脱碳进程举步维艰。【原文：Weak oil prices are making it harder for the shipping industry to decarbonize, according to the president of commodities giant Cargill Inc.’s freight-trading business.】

item.title: 亚洲遭遇寒流侵袭 气温骤降或将刷新气象纪录
item.description: 一股刺骨的北极冷空气将于下周席卷亚洲，可能将气温推向历史最低水平，并可能推高主要能源市场的供暖需求。【原文：A blast of frigid Arctic air is set to sweep across Asia next week, pushing temperatures toward potentially record lows and likely boosting heating demand in key energy markets.】

item.title: 尼日利亚乡村太阳能热潮点亮当地经济
item.description:
长期为尼日利亚经济提供动力的柴油发电机正逐渐让位于太阳能电池板，这在一定程度上得益于世界银行一项7.5亿美元的计划。

【原文：

The diesel-powered generators that have long powered the Nigerian economy are making way for solar panels, thanks in part to a $750 million World Bank campaign.

】

item.title: 我们对气候融资的理解是否完全错误？
item.description:
本周在《零》节目中，丽莎·萨克斯指出当前气候融资模式无法有效实现减排目标。

【原文：

This week on Zero, Lisa Sachs argues that the current way of doing climate finance does not work for reducing emissions.

】

item.title: 摩根大通、布鲁克菲尔德看好清洁能源资产交易复苏
item.description: 据该领域顶尖交易商透露，随着电力需求前景持续向好，加之资产估值预期趋于一致，清洁能源项目正蓄势重启并购活动。【原文：Clean energy projects are poised for a revival in mergers and acquisitions activity on the strengthening outlook for electricity demand and as expectations on asset valuations converge, according to some of the sector’s top dealmakers.】

item.title: 尼日利亚计划于2026年通过国内绿色债券筹集10亿美元
item.description: 尼日利亚正寻求投资者支持其计划今年发行的1.5万亿奈拉（10亿美元）绿色债券。【原文：Nigeria is seeking backers for a 1.5 trillion naira ($1 billion) green bond it aims to issue this year.】

item.title: 全球正经历"极端"气温飙升
item.description: 2025年全球平均气温数据出炉，情况不容乐观。去年成为有记录以来第三热的年份，仅次于……前两年。【原文：The global average temperature numbers are in for 2025 and they’re not good. Last year was the third-hottest on record, trailing only … the previous two years.】

item.title: 英国在海上风电拍卖中大幅增加支持力度
item.description: 尽管成本不断攀升，英国仍加大了对海上风电场的支持力度，以加速实现2030年清洁能源的宏伟目标。【原文：Britain stepped up support for offshore wind farms despite rising prices, as it races to meet an ambitious 2030 clean-power goal.】

item.title: 波兰回收企业豪掷数百万押注欧洲关键金属战略
item.description: 欧洲正积极寻求在关键材料市场立足，这有望使波兰最大的回收企业受益，因为该地区正致力于减少对中国依赖。【原文：Europe’s push to get a foothold in the critical materials market is poised to benefit Poland’s biggest recycling company as the continent looks to cut its reliance on China.】

item.title: 曼谷醒来时，有毒空气正窒息着中央商务区
item.description: 曼谷居民清晨醒来时，天空笼罩着一片朦胧的污染雾霾，当局敦促该市主要商业和金融中心区域的居民尽量留在室内。【原文：Bangkok residents woke up to a hazy, polluted sky, with authorities urging people in the city’s main business and financial hubs to stay indoors.】

item.title: 科学家证实2025年为史上第三热年份，仅次于2024年和2023年
item.description:
去年是有记录以来最温暖的一年之一，尽管拉尼娜天气现象本应使全球气温下降。 

【原文：

Last year was one of the warmest on record, even with a La Niña weather cycle that worked to cool the world down. 

】

item.title: 英国精算师对低估气候风险的损失模型敲响警钟
item.description: 英国主要精算师协会最新研究指出，金融业正依赖低估气温上升速度的气候模型。【原文：The finance industry is relying on climate models that understate the speed at which temperatures are rising, according to a fresh study by Britain’s main association of actuaries.】

item.title: 纽约要求数据中心支付更高电费
item.description: 纽约州计划要求数据中心运营商承担更多高能耗设施的电力成本，旨在防止电力需求激增推高家庭水电费。【原文：New York plans to require data center operators to shoulder more of the cost of powering their energy-hungry facilities, aiming to prevent surging electricity demand from pushing up household utility bills.】

item.title: 奥斯特德海上风电项目在与特朗普的法律纠纷中重启
item.description: 特朗普政府在打击风电的法律战中遭遇挫败。法官裁定风电开发商奥斯特德公司可重启罗德岛州近海"革命风电"项目的建设。【原文：The Trump administration has lost a legal battle in its war on wind. A judge has ruled that wind developer Orsted can restart construction on its Revolution Wind project off the coast of Rhode Island.】

item.title: 美国环保署在制定空气污染法规时将不再考虑人类健康效益的价值
item.description:
该机构正在放弃一项长期政策，即通过减少某些污染物来计算避免死亡和疾病所带来的经济节约。【原文：

The agency is abandoning a longstanding policy to calculate the monetary savings in avoided deaths and disease from cutting certain pollutants.

】

item.title: 尼日利亚计划发行3.52亿美元绿色债券用于气候项目
item.description: 尼日利亚计划今年通过发行绿色债券筹集高达5000亿奈拉（约合3.52亿美元），借此满足投资者强劲需求。作为非洲最大产油国，该国正转向气候相关债券融资，以支持环保项目并实现融资渠道多元化。【原文：Nigeria plans to raise as much as 500 billion naira ($352 million) through green bonds this year, tapping strong investor appetite as Africa’s biggest oil producer turns to climate-linked debt to fund environmental projects and diversify its financing base.】

item.title: 埃奎诺尔采取政治与法律手段解除帝国风电项目停工令
item.description: 挪威国家石油公司首席执行官安德斯·奥佩达尔表示，该公司正采取政治和法律双重途径，力图重启其在纽约近海陷入困境的帝国风电项目。【原文：Equinor ASA is taking both a political and legal approach to revive its beleaguered Empire Wind project off the coast of New York, said Chief Executive Officer Anders Opedal.】

item.title: 数据中心和煤炭推动美国2025年排放量上升
item.description:
该国温室气体排放量估计增长了2.4%，扭转了此前两年的下降趋势。【原文：

The country’s greenhouse gas emissions grew by an estimated 2.4%, reversing the downward trend of the previous two years. 

】

item.title: 摩根大通称需为能源转型中的更多波动性做好准备
item.description: 摩根大通公司表示，全球能源转型的前景可能比投资者预期的更为动荡。【原文：The outlook for the global energy transition is likely to be more volatile than investors may have expected, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】
